title: Bug 16938DCR: Class File Editor should scroll more naturally
description: When using the Class File Editor and trying to scroll through the editor, the scrolling is not smooth. Currently, scrolling using the scrollbar's down arrow only scrolls one pixel at a time, and scrolling using the scrollbar's background only scrolls about a line at a time instead of a page at a time. The workaround is to use the thumb of the scrollbar to scroll. Please fix the scrolling behavior in the Class File Editor to make it more natural and consistent.
OB:
1. Put a breakpoint in a java file, right before a System.out.println statement.
2. Debug to the breakpoint and step into the println call. (Note: It doesn't matter if you go into StringBuffer first, as long as you do not have the source for the class you just stepped into.)
3. A Class File Editor opens.
4. Click on the scrollbar's down arrow.

Problem: The editor only scrolls one pixel at a time.

5. Click on the scrollbar's background to scroll a page at a time.

Problem: The editor only scrolls about a line at a time when it should be scrolling a page at a time.
